intro: Adenophora wulingshanica var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Its botanical features make it a notable species within its native habitat.
